planet.description: Formalhaut is one of the brightest stars in the night sky and located in the constellation Piscis Austrinus. It is a young star with a debris disk. A planet is orbiting the star within the debris disk. Images from the Hubble space telescope clearly show the orbital motion over several years.
planet.imagedescription: The image shows the planet as a tiny point source. A large debris disk surrounds the star. The image was obtained with the Hubble Space Telescope. Credit: NASA, ESA, and P. Kalas (University of California, Berkeley).
